alert.note: Alert for Grafton (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 2:40PM EST until December 19 at 10:37AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Hampshire... Pemigewasset River At Plymouth affecting Belknap and Grafton Counties. Pemigewasset River At Woodstock affecting Grafton County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pemigewasset River at Woodstock. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Route 175 floods to a depth of 2 to 4 feet from Cox Farm Road to Meadow Lane in Woodstock. Low lying areas along US route 3 also flood. At 16.5 feet, Significant flooding occurs along Route 112. Significant flooding also occurs along Route 3 and Route 175 from North Woodstock to West Campton. Some flooding occurs at the Riverfront condo development, the River Green Hotel and the Saint Andrews condos. Water rises up to the low steel on the Route 175 bridge in North Woodstock. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:46 PM EST Monday the stage was 14.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:46 PM EST Monday was 14.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 4.1 feet Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
